meanings.definition: Inflict harm in return for (an injury or wrong).
meanings.sent1: She wanted to avenge her friend's betrayal by standing up to the bully.
meanings.sent2: The hero sought to avenge the innocent villagers by defeating the evil sorcerer.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to avenge its stolen toy by pouncing on the mischievous dog.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to avenge the calmness of the morning with its loud roars.
meanings.sent5: The knight vowed to avenge the fallen kingdom with his sword held high.

meanings.definition: Take vengeance for (an offense or crime).
meanings.sent1: The detective promised to avenge the victim's death by catching the criminal.
meanings.sent2: The avenging angel swooped down to avenge the injustice done to the innocent child.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to avenge its stolen acorn by playfully chasing the thief.
meanings.sent4: The rising sun appeared to avenge the darkness of the night with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The warrior was determined to avenge his fallen comrades by defeating the enemy leader.
